LanguageData.Deer.label: deer
LanguageData.Deer.description: A deer is a medium-sized herding herbivore. It is generally peaceful unless disturbed.
LanguageData.Ibex.label: ibex
LanguageData.Ibex.description: The hardy wild ancestor of the domesticated goat. Ibexes live on marginal territory that most antelopes couldn't survive, eating lichens and sparse mountain plants. They're famous for dexterously hopping across bare cliff faces - and for their violent ramming attack.
LanguageData.Elk.label: moose
LanguageData.Elk.description: A moose or elk is a larger member of the deer family. It is well-adapted to life in cold climates.
LanguageData.Caribou.label: caribou
LanguageData.Caribou.description: A large member of the deer family, well-adapted to life in cold climates.
LanguageData.WildBoar.label: wild boar
LanguageData.WildBoar.description: Although considered impure by some cultures, this hairy ancestor of the domesticated pig is prized for the gamey flavor of its 고기.
LanguageData.Tortoise.label: tortoise
LanguageData.Tortoise.description: This heavily armored land-dwelling reptile is known for its slow moving speed and surprisingly vicious bite.
